author: Special Correspondent
text:
Following the Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam’s (DMDK) pact with the People’s Welfare Front, which has created a “formidable front,” a few parties have evinced keen interest in being part of the alliance, DMDK’s women’s wing leader Premalatha Vijayakant has said.

Speaking to reporters at Thoothukudi airport on Friday evening, Ms. Premalatha said the DMDK–PWF combine has won the hearts of Tamils as it has presented them with a credible alternative for the first time.

As the leaders of the constituent political parties of the combine are working in tandem, the winning prospects have brightened further, she said. Though Tamil Nadu had been ruled by the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam and the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam since 1967, the State is yet to attain the enviable status of ‘Developed State’ as these parties have miserably failed to execute mega schemes and developmental projects, she claimed.

She said the DMDK, in the first phase of electioneering, would organise public meetings in all Corporation areas to explain its manifesto to the voters.

“Once the first phase is completed, the campaign will commence across the State.”

Ms. Premalatha addressed a public meeting here to explain the salient features of the DMDK’s manifesto.
title: Some more parties likely to come on board: Premalatha
